projects.name: Meta-UESTC
projects.shortDesc: Meta-UESTC is an AR Game designed to be used in conjunction with a physical circuit board. It enables users to clearly explore the building layouts as well as video and image information of UESTC, and offers a simulated university game experience.
highlights: Served as the sole developer, responsible for establishing the game framework, developing team tools, game logic and map functionalities, and managing version updates.
Functioned as the project’s game designer, designing a comprehensive simulation of a college experience by creating more than 10000 of events and 100 of in-game achievements.
Secured two patents.
Achieved revenue exceeding 500,000 CNY and maintained a top ranking on a major Chinese social media platform for one day.

detail.value: Meta-UESTC is primarily utilized as the core gift included with the admission letters for incoming freshmen at UESTC.

Meta-UESTC is an AR campus map game software that recognizes patterns on a physical circuit board when scanned with a mobile phone. It can display a scaled model of the University of Electronic Science and Technology of China (UESTC). In the viewing mode, players can click on buildings to view their overall appearance, use two fingers to rotate or zoom in to see building details, and click the "Details" button to view specific information about the buildings, including real-world images and historical background. In the game mode, players take on the role of a new UESTC student and allocate their time to choose courses, clubs, life, competitions, emotions, and research events, aiming to prepare for their future and manage their time efficiently. After four years, players receive a graduation report that reveals the kind of talent they have become, with hundreds of achievements waiting to be unlocked.

The original purpose of this project was to spontaneously improve the school's cultural gifts and promote the reform of school entertainment products. It later became the core gift for UESTC's 22nd and 23rd student admission letters, designed to help new students quickly familiarize themselves with the campus structure and life, and prepare for their future and time management. Media coverage has turned it into a promotional product for the school at the admission level, attracting a large number of students to apply to our school.

In this project, I was primarily responsible for the software planning and programming of Meta-UESTC, as well as some art-related tasks. For software planning, I designed the software's exhibition and game systems, including text content, artistic effects (dynamic effects, shaders), tutorials, core gameplay, value planning, and achievement system planning, among other core software functions. In terms of programming, I implemented all the software features, including subsequent updates to Meta-UESTC 2.0, maintenance of the Android download platform website, and more. In art-related tasks, I handled all animation production and shader creation.

In terms of planning, I learned how to design exhibition halls and cultivation-style game development. This included creating Gantt charts for resource allocation in game development, verifying the reasonableness of game data by filling in thousands of data sheets and using MATLAB for data calculation, expanding and optimizing game-related functions based on user feedback from trial players, and writing in-game content. For programming, I learned the concept of extensible frameworks, especially in the context of long-term project code maintenance and optimization. Specifically, I learned AR/VR program development, batch data processing tool creation, and various core systems and optimization algorithms. In terms of art, I learned how to create effects through programming, including creating shaders through code and connections. Animation effects were also essential, and I learned general animation design by continuously adjusting and designing animation curves. In terms of marketing and management, I learned how to operate and sell the game and physical products, including media promotion, advertisement creation, and post-promotion.

projects.name: Rural Vows with Me
projects.shortDesc: Rural Vows with Me is an AR software designed to be used in conjunction with a physical circuit board. It aims to collect and share the achievements and contributions of university poverty alleviation initiatives across China and is distributed as a souvenir at the National University Poverty Alleviation Conference in China.
highlights: Established standardized protocols and collected poverty alleviation data from over 80 Chinese universities, managing program outcomes and contributions in a tabulated format.
Implemented a mesh-based positioning system to automatically locate and plot universities from various regions onto distinct sections of the Chinese map.
Developed dynamic visual effects for the map, including flowing light animations and various other animated transitions.
As the sole programmer, engineered the complete software framework and feature set, and developed tools for batch organizing and processing large volumes of data.

detail.value: Rural Vows with Me is an AR project display software. This project collaborates with the National Education Bureau's university poverty alleviation efforts, showcasing the achievements and specific content of over 80 well-known domestic universities' poverty alleviation projects. Through text descriptions, physical images, and videos, it highlights the poverty alleviation outcomes of various projects. The project combines electronic technology with AR software, creating a combination of physical circuit boards and AR software to enhance visual presentation. This product is used as a souvenir gift for the National University Poverty Alleviation Conference.

The primary purpose of Rural Vows with Me is to serve as a souvenir gift for experts and leaders attending the conference. Additionally, it aims to showcase the achievements of various universities in regional poverty alleviation efforts in recent years. By combining physical and AR-enhanced visual elements, this product not only serves as a collectible physical souvenir but also offers extended visual appeal.

In this project, I was primarily responsible for the software planning, programming, and some technical art aspects. Regarding planning, I handled system planning, data requirements planning, and artistic effects planning for all software. I collected information on poverty alleviation achievements from over 80 universities and preprocessed the data. In terms of programming, I was responsible for all the software's programming, including batch data processing, core framework construction, and system design. In technical art, I handled the modeling and segmentation of the map of China, as well as the creation and optimization of all shaders in the software.

Besides, I learned how to negotiate with multiple platforms, obtain relevant information, and ensure compliance. We successfully collected specific poverty alleviation information from 86 out of 96 universities, and the project systematically showcased this information. I also learned about the importance of combining real economic business value with virtual economic business value in the industry.

projects.name: Light&Heavy
projects.shortDesc: Light&Heavy is a 3D puzzle game centered on swapping the weights of two objects, featuring ingenious combinations of classic mechanical elements such as pulleys, gears, and levers.
highlights: As the Programmer, fine-tuned the physics engine, implemented level transition logic, developed the dialogue system, and established various event triggers.
In the role of Technical Artist, delivered stylized rendering, particle effects, scene transition effects, as well as opening and closing animations.
Serving as both Level Designer and User Experience Technologist, designed and tested game levels while incorporating player feedback for continuous improvement.
In an operational capacity, leveraged promotional articles and social media management to elevate the game's popularity, achieving a top 10 ranking on Chinese gaming platforms.

detail.value: Originally themed "Light", this project centers on a core gameplay mechanic where players use a handheld device to swap the masses of objects. The main objective is to solve 3D puzzles by exchanging object weights within various scenes. Starting with the concept of a lever, the game progressively introduces more complex structures—such as pulley systems and gears—drawing from fundamental principles of physics and mechanics. Most mechanisms are designed as levers or components of a lever system, challenging players to observe, learn, and explore innovative solutions. This elegant and intuitive physics-based puzzle game offers significant potential for future development.

projects.name: Bulimia
projects.shortDesc: For fame and prestige, you, as a chef, have struck a pact with a demon, granting you endless ingredients and an unceasing stream of diners. But beware—never slow down your cooking. Should you falter, both the ingredients and the guests may lead you to an inescapable fate.
highlights: Served as the lead programmer, responsible for developing the game framework and implementing the core logic.
Completed the creation of all dynamic, non-frame animations within the levels.
Designed several levels.

detail.value: The theme is 'Limited and Limitless'. In this game player plays as a chef who needs to cook a growing pile of flesh in the back of the kitchen to de-activate it and fulfil orders. The core gameplay is a variant of 'Sokoban', which allows you to push a crate from the other side by switching places with the crate if one side is blocked, simplifying the crate pushing part of the game and encouraging intuitive action. The cooking and serving process is similar to 'Overcooked', but it is worth mentioning that the growing flesh will cause damage to the player standing on top of it, making the game very challenging in the later stages.The theme is 'Limited and Limitless'. projects.name: Nocturne of The Frog In The Moonlight
projects.shortDesc: Step into the role of a little frog from a fairy tale. Harnessing the magical power of growing vines, embark on a journey toward the moon suspended in the heavens to reclaim nature’s vibrant vitality. This is a fairy tale for frogs—a lyrical ode dedicated to the moon.
projects.coverImage: /projects/Nocturne of The Frog In The Moonlight/cover.jpg
highlights: Original Game Music Synthesizer – Integrates gameplay progress with dynamic music tracks, binding player movement to musical layers. As players ascend to different heights, the soundtrack shifts seamlessly, enriching the atmosphere and deepening immersion.

Custom Tilemap Generator – Utilizes textures and custom collision nodes to create diverse terrain interactions and material variations. This ensures that each playthrough generates a fresh and exhilarating new environment, making every run a unique experience.

projects.name: Life Spreading
projects.shortDesc: Life Spreading is a coding puzzle game where you must genetically program your plant cells to grow and survive in a harsh and unforgiving land.
highlights: Allows players to program seeds, enabling highly customizable gameplay.
Features a fully designed UI with programming save files, allowing players to share their code.
Incorporates dynamic weather changes that simulate the four seasons: spring, summer, fall, and winter.

detail.value: "The Spread of Life" is a programming puzzle game where you need to design unique genes that enable your seeds to undergo cell division, ultimately leading to the successful growth, flowering, and fruition of your seeds.

The backdrop and idea of this game are inspired by Conway's Game of Life from the field of computer science, which dictates the 'reproduction' and 'death' of cells through a few simple rules, thereby achieving Turing completeness. In our game, we also want to enable a seed to grow healthily by allowing players to specify special rules. As the seasons change, you will face the challenges of different seasons. How should you design your plant's genes to enable it to grow on different terrains and through the various seasons?

detail.value: Pseudo-Harvest is a simple puzzle game.
You need to drag some stuff into the granary, and cover its surface with grain.

Its concept bases on a bureaucratic society based on a planned economy

projects.name: Time.Loop()
projects.shortDesc: Impossible box pushing—unless you can create a time paradox.
highlights: Achieved third place in the national collegiate game development competition.
Developed an original puzzle gameplay mechanic based on the concept that what has already happened cannot be undone.
Features a diverse array of levels.
Meta Dialogs

detail.value: One day, you stumble upon an abandoned AI device that still manages to power on.
But when you activate it, you discover that this self-aware AI is forcefully dragging you into a game of box pushing.
At first, the puzzles seem rather simple.
Until one day, she presents you with an unsolvable level—complete with a "rewind" button.
However, this "rewind" button isn’t just a typical undo feature.

When you press it, time rewinds right before your eyes. Suddenly, the level resets to its original state, and you see your past self—a perfect duplicate of you, in block form—standing at the starting position, about to repeat your previous moves.
Perhaps you can leverage all of this to create a paradox and conquer the seemingly unsolvable level.

projects.name: ASCD(Anniversary Arcade Game)
projects.shortDesc: ASCD is a promotional game developed for UESTC Publishing House to celebrate UESTC's 65th anniversary.
highlights: Over a hundred people played our game and competed for high scores.
It effectively promoted the school's anniversary celebration and led to a significant increase in the sales of celebratory merchandise compared to previous years.

detail.value: A commercially outsourced production, UESTC publisher designed four discipline-related characters for use in the development of cultural and creative products. Our team was asked to select their settings for a second creation to promote and market other creative products in the form of an offline trial game. Considering the need for offline presentation, a relatively challenging cross-board shooter clearance game was designed, with a display of point leaderboards to promote competitive play.

projects.name: Capture
projects.shortDesc: Trapped in a timeless Möbius strip where destruction and truth coexist, embark on a journey to uncover the hidden secrets of the black hole in uncharted deep space.
highlights: Approximately 30 minutes of gameplay.
A fully open map that allows players to explore freely.
Innovative time loop puzzle-solving.

detail.value: Capture is a 2D open-world time puzzle game in the vein of Outer Wilds. Players must explore and uncover all the small, time-loop puzzles hidden within various environments. By understanding these individual cycles, they can piece together the overarching enigma of the Capture spacecraft, ultimately resolving a series of mysteries surrounding its explosion, demise, and other inexplicable events.

projects.name: Dungeon of Ancient Gods
projects.shortDesc: A puzzle game, but unlike regular puzzle games, you need to play as an ancient god to help someone solve puzzles.
highlights: An AI with a certain degree of learning intelligence.
Innovative reverse haunted house gameplay.

detail.value: There is  an ancient god lying in a state of slumber, waiting for power to recover in the depths of a sacred temple.

From the birth of human beings this temple seems to stand here. After tens of thousands of years of winds and rains, people have already forgotten the origin of this temple. Only heard that this is the residence of a horrible existence in the old time, shall not disturb that unspeakable god eternal sleep.
But as more and more people explored the temple, they felt that there was nothing special about it except that the building was old, and gradually people began to think that unspeakable god had left.
Stupid mortals! They deceived by the illusion of ancient god’s absence, clung to the persistent whispers of legends that whispered of dormant existence.

Until one day, a ignorant spirit ventured into temple. Ancient god just marveled at its ignorance and foolishness, as it happens, his powers are almost back. The unspeakable one decided to assist it in unraveling the puzzles within temple to free himself and let the world tremble in his presence of awakening again.

home.bio: Liheng Zou is currently a first-year graduate student at Duke University, specializing in Game Design, Development & Innovation. He earned his undergraduate degree in Electronic Information Engineering from the University of Electronic Science and Technology of China (UESTC). As an interaction designer, Zou has achieved notable recognition, including a provincial third prize at the National University Student Advertising Design Competition and national second prizes at the Milan Design Week – China Design Exhibition in both 2022 and 2023. As a game designer, he distinguished himself by ranking 26th out of 1,144 entries in competitions such as Ludum Dare 52 and The Jam, and by securing first place along with the Best Design award at the Global Game Jam – Chongqing Station, China (GGJ) in 2023. Beyond his competition accolades, Zou boasts extensive practical experience. He has interned at Season (Xi Shan Ju) and Chengdu XD Entertainment Co., Ltd., and served as a lab assistant in UESTC's Interactive Media Lab for two years, where he contributed to designing the university’s admission letters for 2022 and 2023. At Duke University, he has also collaborated with the ICU department of Duke Hospital to develop an XR game aimed at facilitating patient rehabilitation. Currently, Zou is dedicated to developing MangaHero, a high-speed action game that showcases his passion for innovative game design and dynamic gameplay.
